GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Let me prove my worth.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: For %d gildar, I tie my fate to yours, if you'll have me.
UnitType.Backstory: This weapon fits to my hand, if you can see. It was my mother's hammer, and she put it to good use, and I'll do the same, fighting for you. Fighting those grayskins what killed her, and the rest of Kairengdon. The mines filled with blood that day, and I aim to see blood as well. If you call for it, that is.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Never again will a son watch his father slain for breadcrumbs.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Fair met, stranger. If it's fighters you seek, I would ask you consider me. My spear is strong, my price fair - %d gildar - and my fealty, once pledged, shall never be broken.
UnitType.Backstory: It's the Iron Hills I came from, friend. But the miner's life was not for me. Nor would I serve as another's wife, to fetch water and mend clothes. I like the feel of a weapon in my hand; I like seeing the things that are out there, in the wide world, while I've got the strength to do so. I'll seek my rest when I'm dead.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'None should go digging in the past.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d gildar - that seems to me a fair price for my services, but of course, we can bargain if you wish.
UnitType.Backstory: Yes, I am expert with the staff. I was taught by a man named Yoska, a Padar of the old ways. There was in my village a ruin, a temple of Morain, who was the most powerful of the Five, and this was tended by Yoska. And I was a little girl, curious as all children are, and I saw him fight these brigands away from the temple and its relics - five of them, against one old man, swords and armor against a staff, and he beat them all down. He could have killed them, but that is not the way of the Padars. They worship life, you see. And so from him I learned the staff, and before you ask - the way of the Padars, that is not my way. I have killed. Life is war, is it not? This I have learned from my family, no we are not warriors, we are merchants, but in commerce, my mother has taught me, there are winners and losers as well, and it is best always to be on the winning side. I am expert in the ways of money as well, and this knowledge too you will have if you hire my services..

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: Never underestimate the wisdom of a woman.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Hail and well met, friend. I am Shannon of Vurthela. I am a skilled administrator, and require only %d gildar for my services.
UnitType.Backstory: The money is for my village, friend, not me. Vurthela was nearly destroyed some years ago, and we are still rebuilding. I would return - my family lives there still - but I can do more out in the world. I feel an obligation to do more - the Destiny has put us all here to help one another, I believe. And there is so much help that is needed, the world is so broken... I wish to serve. You speak of a desire to unite all of mankind - I share this, for we are all of us sisters and brothers beneath the skin. When I traveled with the Knights - I was of their ranks once, the Azure Knights - I learned this truth, eternal, undying. I hope you share my belief.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Only those brave enough to rebel can know true freedom.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Pay %d gildar to Svedd, his axe becomes yours.
UnitType.Backstory: Only those brave enough to rebel can know true freedom. These are words of Tarth, who shares them with Svedd, before war comes. Now you and I, friend, we must rebel against all of this world, to make new one.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'They say I seek wealth for poor reasons. Is there a good reason?'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: For %d gildar I will help grow your settlements.
UnitType.Backstory: I have a banker's training, friend. I have a banker's mind. You may find glory in empire, or in seeking the greater good; I have no interest in those things. They will not help me render assistance to you. I balance profit against loss; risk against reward. In this way will I help you succeed; in this way will I increase my own worth as well.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: All fear the tip of my spear.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I will bring glory to you, and to your name, if you will take me into your service. I ask only a modest feet - %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: I am Urxen, from Nurdenhaag. My family was nothing. My father was no one. He is buried in a battlefield far from here, in a grave I will never find. I do not intend to die in the same way - I wish my name to be remembered, I wish my deeds to be honored, I wish to taste the fruits of victory before my time comes.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I don't care for the Quendar; it's the smell.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I promise you honest service, for as long as you will have me. As long as you will pay me. %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: I speak my mind. Do not hire me if you seek a simpleton for a companion. A wordless lackey. I am Quendar. My people were made as soldiers, and we serve with heart and soul, body and mind. My father was named Deras as well, and his father before him, and it is a name I will not dishonor through service to one unworthy. The last who hired me was cruel to those who served her, and so I left my sword in her heart, and set out to find a sovereign with honor.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: If you won't pay me my true worth, then I will find someone who will.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Money? I know a thing or two about money. Give me %d gildar to manage yours for you, and I'll make you good coin, friend, I promise I will.
UnitType.Backstory: I'll take the fee, I'll take a percentage, if you'd rather that. As long as you're fair with me, I'll work night and day for you, and that's a fact. I'll fight for you as well. This dagger, it's not just for show, I don't mind a good scrap, get the blood flowing, and that's a fact too, anyone who knows me'll tell you that.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Leadership is needed in these hard times.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I seek glory in battle. I seek a worthy sovereign. Let me fight for you; I charge only %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Since I was a young boy, I have dreamed only of becoming a great warrior. I have spent my life studying the great commanders of the past; Dariun, and Athicar, I know their every battles. You give me the chance to fight for you, both our names will become great. This I vow

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: I feel no pain.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: You seek warriors? You seek fighters for your cause? Kunsetti Kava is greatest warrior you will find. %d gildar, you give, Kunsetti will join you.
UnitType.Backstory: Two lives, Kunsetti has lived. This is true. In service of the great Abaja, last of the Adorri tribe, I was killed. Abaja himself brought me back to life, a second time. Abaja used on me the Ring of the Phoenix - one moment, Kunsetti Kava is bleeding in the desert sand, and the next... he is back in Abaja's palace. This is how the Ring works. But only once, Abaja told me, and set me free from his service, to find another to fight for. Now Kunsetti Kava has found you!

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'With the knowledge of two lifetimes, I will rebuild the world.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I have no wish to walk the wastes alone. I seek a patron to serve, to help me survive. %d gildar will serve as my fee.
UnitType.Backstory: I have much to offer to the one who hires me, for I was raised in the shadow of Odenvell. Before the Oracle rose, before the time of Transformation, many came questing to our village, seeking the treasures of the past, and from them I learned knowledge of all corners of the world. This knowledge can be yours as well, if you meet my price.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Furthering the technology of war will always provide results.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I am Serenes of the Quendar, stranger. My race was born to service. For %d gildar, I shall keep you and yours safe.
UnitType.Backstory: Do you know of the Quendar? We were made from man, raised to the side of Curgen himself, and sworn to his service. We are steel, tempered from the moment of birth. We know no fear, we know no mercy, unless it is commanded by the one in whose service we are pledged. When the world cracked, when the walls of Imperium fell, the Quendar stood strong at Curgen's side. When the fire of Delin brought down the wrath of the titans, when rocks fell from the sky like raindrops, it was the Quendar who formed a shield that the women and children of the great city could reach shelter unharmed. For two dozen generations, the family of Sergenes served the masters of the East - but the Titans and their lieutenants are no more, and so I, Sergenes, must seek a sovereign worthy of my loyalty. My trust. I wonder if you, stranger, are that ruler.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I am a healer of ills, those of of body, mind, and spirit.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Fair met, friend. I am Keirgann, of the Iron Tribes. Of the far mountains. I am a healer. My services can be hired for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: The money I ask is only enough to live on - to be able to gather the things I need, the herbs and talismans and what-not. That's my cause, friend, and the only one I care about. Aye, I'll fight if I have to - this hammer is a weapon, not a tool - but to my way of thinking, there's been enough fighting in this world to last a thousand years. Enough fighting, enough death... time to fix things, I say. Time to heal them, before it's too late.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The wasteland is no place for a skilled merchant like myself.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Greetings, friend. I am Leadanna, of the House Merdici. A merchant, yes, but a skilled adminstrator as well. %d gildar, and I am yours to command.
UnitType.Backstory: May I be honest with you, my friend? I can fight, yes, I have studied the ways of the staff, but it is with numbers - with coin - that I am most comfortable. Always it has been this way, since I was a little girl. I was quite sickly, you see - quite thin, quite frail. Much time did I spend indoors, while my brothers played, but this was for good, in the end, I learned from my uncle Carando the skills of the trader. And so it was that when my aunt passed, I was the one chosen to accompany Carando and his caravans across the wastes. That is why I survived, for when the Black Summer came... I was fortunate, I suppose. I am the last of the Merdici, though - when I pass from the world, the name passes with me.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Arm the meek! Emancipation is paid for with blood!'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I am interested in joining you. Does %d gildar sound like a fair rate for my skills?
UnitType.Backstory: Service is all I know. I was taken from my mother when I had seen only eight summers. I was made a slave. I was raised a slave. I killed my overseer, and escaped. But when I returned my village was in ruins. I will never see my family again.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The only good beast is the one that pulls the plow, for that beast knows its place!'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Halt, stranger. Natilya has offer for you. %d of your gildar, I march with you.
UnitType.Backstory: Wastes are full of dangerous things; pinkskins, grayskins, creatures... great spiders, Natila has killed with her spear. Many of them. She has killed warg many times too - wargs are good eating, yes? You hire Natila, I skin them, cook them for you. Is good to eat heart of the warg, make you strong. I have heard heart of slag is good to eat too... but never has Natila eaten slag. Never has Natila fought slag. Something to look forward to, yes? You and Natila, we kill slag together!

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'To better understand magic is the reason I travel the wastes.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: You are a channeler? Please, I wish to join you, I will gladly do that, I need money, yes, but not much - would %d gildar be fair?
UnitType.Backstory:
It's adventure I seek, yes, you are right, but not for the mere thrill of it. Do you know of Antheros? The great cities of Atalandra, and Redstone? The world that was, before the Cataclysm? There are remnants of that great civlization out there, relics that once belonged to its kings and queens, its heroes and its villains and above all, its channelers. Denara and Larrent, Az-Adoras, Hosten and yes, even his son, the Patricide, he was a great channeler as well, and it is magic I am interested in, magic and those who learned to master it.
My father was clearing a small bit of forest when I was a small boy, and he came upon a worn and rotting chest, and on it was the royal seal, from Antheros itself, and in it were all these scrolls, most of them near rotted away, but a few... they were parts of a spellbook, and the things those spells could do... bring life to the land, focus these great energies.. .those are things worth seeking, don't you think? Things the world needs, and I want... I want there to be cities again, and palaces, and I am willing to fight to make that happen. And I can handle myself in battle, I only have a staff it's true, but if you will take me on... I will do right, in your name, if you will have me.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'To find my brother, by any means necessary.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d gildar is my fee, stranger. For that modest sum, my skills as a warrior are at your beck and call, night and day.
UnitType.Backstory: I have mastery of the mace, and knowledge of the sword. I fought with honor alongside the Azure Knights, during the Revolt. You may rest assured, stranger, that should you pay my fee, you shall have my undivided loyalties. I would ask, however, if you have seen - or had word - of a warrior named Myrol, also a master of the mace. For he is my brother, twin to me, lost now a half-dozen years. Taken captive, he and his troop, by a band of darklings while crossing the Western Wastes. If you have any knowledge of him at all, you would lighten my heart greatly by relaying it.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I was saved by magic once and now I yearn to understand how.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Hail. I seek coin for my service - %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: It hurts me to speak, stranger - an old wound - so I will be brief. My axe is yours, and I have knowledge of the arcane arts as well that I will put at your service, if you hire me.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I am a reflection of the world: barren, indifferent, and full of hate.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: War is the way of the world. You pay me, I fight for you. %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: It is best, young friend, to think of me merely as a weapon. A tool. Buy me, use me as you see fit. I will kill on your command, or I will injure. I will maim, if you wish. Pick a target, set me loose. I have no fear. I have no feelings at all. This is not cruelty. This is what is, for war is the way of all things in this world. There is want, and not enough to go around. Always, this has been true, but after the transformation... in my family, we were not rich, but there was enough to eat, always. I was the middle, the youngest boy. But always the biggest. Always the hungriest. There was fighting... there were targets. One must eat to live, young friend. I could not share. To have no regrets.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'A little charm goes a long way for profit.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Straavni, friend. Straavni. Those are handsome clothes you are wearing. You have good taste, I can see. So you should hire me on to join your company - I am sure you have heard of Klavarra. %d gildar is my fee.
UnitType.Backstory: Truthfully, I grow weary of wandering. These are dangerous lands for a woman traveling alone... I seek to join my fate with someone ambitious. Someone who has the will, and the means, to make the world a safer place. For me. Hah. Of course I am joking - Klavarra is deeply concerned with the welfare of others. With the welfare of the entire world. But Klavarra is hungry, too. Let us eat, and talk further.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Why have I been forsaken?'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Shalaam, stranger. I am Mazi, last of the Sula. I will join your army for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: In the time before this one, the Sula were the greatest fighters of the Southern tribes. But our lands were drowned in the cataclysm, and then our women stolen by the Quendar. I am the last to carry the spear of Sulandi. Should you hire my service, I ask only this of you, that you break my weapon should I fall in battle. Break my weapon, and burn it, and let none mark my grave, for the Sula belong to the desert.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I fell into this profession long ago, but it is all I have ever known.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: If you seek to build an empire, you will find my services of great value. %d gildar is my fee, payable in advance.
UnitType.Backstory: I took no schooling; I learned the skills of administration by watching my husband work, by listening to those who served under him discuss his various deeds. When my husband passed... I put a knife through the heart of his second, and took his job for myself. Treat me fairly, and I will work hard for you. Cross me, and you will live to regret it.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I am a soldier for hire, yes, and a healer as well.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Greetings. It is Giavanna of the Capitarii who stands before you, friend. I am a soldier for hire, yes, and a healer as well, for the price of %d gildar, I will join you.
UnitType.Backstory: My family does not approve of what I do, friend, I must warn you, they may come looking for me. I was to follow my mother in the counting-house, to deal with the merchants of Capitarii, but I found I did not like sitting in a little hut, writing numbers all day. So I took a little money, and this mace - yes, I can use it, I will show you if you wish - and brought my amulet, and I set out to make my own way in the world. Like my brother Gianti before me. If it is a man's right to do so... it is a woman's as well, yes? Perhaps you do not agree?

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I can express only my humor and dismay at your level of cognition.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Good day, friend. My name is Roydrik, and have little doubt of your need for my assistance, which I would provide for a mere %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: I do not care to know your intentions, friend, or those of any companions that may travel with you. I seek only the opportunity to make use of my great and varied skills; to add to the store of knowledge and experience I have amassed traveling the world. Yes, I will fight for you as well, if you wish, though you would be smarter to utilize my skills elsewhere. If you don't mind my saying so.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'My axe can build villages, clear forests, or leave a battlefield littered with burnt corpses.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Gildar, they are like children sometimes, yes? You must yell at them to make them come out. So if I yell - forgive me. %d gildar, you give to Evgenya, he yells no more.
UnitType.Backstory: You like Jenna's axe? They call this burning axe, because you grip handle, blade bursts into flame. Yes? Is good weapon Jenna has. I use it on your enemies, you hire me. Makes good to chop trees, too, you like Jenna to help you build village. I have axe since I was small boy, from my brother, who is killed by lord from the West. Lord from Ithul. This man, he calls my father traitor to race of man, and kills him, kills my brother, burns my house. Someday I find this Lord, I burn him.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Long have I been hunted, yet I remain.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: You seek the throne that once belonged to Curgen? I would aid your cause, for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: My qualifications? In battle, I killed two score soldiers, perhaps more. This was when I fought with the Urxen of my tribe. And then... my legion was no more. But I remain despite the efforts ot the enemies of my tribe.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I am Nosmina, of Resoln. I seek to be hired.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I am Nosmina, of Resoln. I seek to be hired. %d gildar for my service.
UnitType.Backstory: I tell you, you will get a bargain if you hire Nosmina. Before, I have charged double what I ask now, and people paid gladly. But now... I need money. The gildar you give me - I will use it for the root of the calivar - this is an ingredient in a healing salve I require to treat an old injury. It does not affect my fighting, no, but it is not an ordinary wound... a sorcerer... a man called Meerduul... he is responsible. In the village I am from, there was a battle... we drove him from the town, but at a terrible cost... my father was killed. My brother as well. Sometimes when I fight... the scar burns... it reminds me of them. This is a good thing.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I'll bring forth life, where there was none before.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Fair weather to you, friend. I am Lochar of the Iron tribes. These are dangerous lands you've come upon - for %d gildar, I'll put my knowledge to your service.
UnitType.Backstory: A question for you, friend. Do you believe in the old gods? The Elemental Lords? Ah, it's none of my business, I suppose, what you believe. But you best be prepared for anything, if you're going out in the wastelands there. I could tell you stories... turn your hair white. And it's not just the Lords you'll be meeting out there - the Five. There are the lesser Elementals too... things of the earth, and the air. This staff here, it can handle them well enough, and it's at your service. For the right price, as I said.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I prefer numbers to people. Numbers don't lie. Confuse, of course, but they never lie.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d gildar would sway me into your employ, my friend.
UnitType.Backstory: I was apprentice to the House of Lamord, my friend, but now I seek to make my own fortune. I do not brag to tell you I am a master of trade. If you hire me to your cause, I promise you never will be cheated. This kingdom you seek to build, I will pave its roads for you.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'There is a distinct beauty that comes with understanding.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Greetings, my friend. Long have I sought a worthy sovereign to follow; for %d gildar, I will pledge my loyalty to you.
UnitType.Backstory: This world in which we live, my friend, it is broken. Do you not feel this way? I have learned so much of the past, so much of what has been lost... I wish to fix things. To make things whole again. I seek a leader, who feels the same.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: It is better to be the queen of ruin than a slave to fortune.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Hail, and well met, stranger. I am a soldier for hire, for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: I will speak plainly. My sovereign is dead, and I seek a new one to follow. A new employer as well, yes. What are your intentions?

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Our greatest dreams can indeed manifest themselves in dark times. Mine did.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I propose a price of %d gildar for my services.
UnitType.Backstory: I was raised to the blade, stranger. I have some skill with it, as you will see if you hire me. But I have also studied the spellbooks of the great enchanters - of the Titans, and the Patricide, and the pinkskin Hosten. I can be of use to you, understanding the nature of those kinds of magics as well.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Uza is fighter. Pay Uza and he fights for you.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Uza is fighter; pay Uza %d gildar, he fights for you.
UnitType.Backstory: Uza's father was great warrior; Uza's mother was Edar. Uza knows fire; Uza knows war. To kill, to burn... these things make Uza happy.
